examples: the berries were plump and sweet

verb.description: Shake or pat (a cushion or pillow) to adjust its stuffing and make it rounded and soft.

noun.description: An abrupt plunge; a heavy fall.

adverb.description: With a sudden or heavy fall.
examples: she sat down plump on the bed
he must tell her plump and plain that he was collecting unemployment

origin: Late Middle English (in sense group of people): of uncertain origin; possibly related to clump and lump.
